author: Mohammad Ali
text:
Tension prevailed in Meerut on Wednesday after four cows from Baba Manoharnath temple went missing on Tuesday night.

The BJP and Hindutva groups staged a sit-in demanding the immediate arrest of miscreants.

SP govt. blamed

Uttar Pradesh BJP chief L.K. Bajpayee alleged that the Samajwadi Party government was protecting cow smugglers and those who slaughtered cows.

He demanded that those who stole the cows be slapped with the stringent National Security Act.

Mr. Bajpayee asked the State administration to release the details about the number of “missing cows” ever since the SP government came to power.

“We know that the stolen cows must have been slaughtered by now. That is why we demand that the cow smugglers be immediately arrested and slapped with the NSA,” he told The Hindu .

According to temple priest Neelimanand, the four cows were stolen early on Tuesday from the temple by slaughterers.

The Vishwa Hindu Parishad and the Bajrang Dal along with Mr. Bajpayee and BJP MP from Meerut Rajinder Agarwal reached the temple along with volunteers.

Heavy police force was present outside the temple, while senior police officers reached the spot to calm down the protesters and BJP leaders.

It was only after the police officials sought five days from the Hindutva groups for recovery of the cows that the Hindutva leaders said they would not take to streets over the issue.

Mr. Bajpayee, however, was sceptical and said the SP government never took any action against those who smuggled and killed cows.

Samajwadi Party govt. protecting cow slaughterers,

says Uttar Pradesh

BJP chief
title: Meerut tense after cows go missing from temple
